summary: This bill mandates that the United States Postal Service (USPS) notify customers and relevant officials when a post office temporarily suspends operations. The bill outlines specific requirements for these notifications, including the expected start date, reasons for the suspension, plans for providing postal services during the suspension, an estimate of when operations will resume, and status updates if the suspension lasts over six months. The USPS must also provide an opportunity for public comment and provide alternative retail postal services.  The bill applies only to suspensions starting after the date of its enactment.
